poll_list.title: Approve Multisig for Management of Velodrome NFT - October 3, 2022

discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] Create a Multisig to manage the $VELO veNFT

content.content: Sentence Summary Create a 3/4 multi-sig to manage the airdrop MakerDAO received from Velodrome Finance.  Paragraph Summary After the prior vote passed to manage the veNFT through Executive Spells, I met with @brianmcmichael and the Velodrome Finance team to understand how we could manage the veNFT in a maximally decentralized way. Unfortunately, voting the veNFT is not practical and an inefficient use of the PECU team’s time. A multi-sig was determined to be the best solution for managing the airdrop.  Motivation The veNFT will allow MakerDAO to direct emissions to the liquidity pools of their choosing, increasing liquidity of the chosen pairs and receiving all trading fees and bribes for those pools. Weekly trading fees for the DAI/USDC pair alone have been as high as $150K annualized.  Multi-sig Signers I am seeking four trusted community members to volunteer to be signers for a MIP47 compliant multi-sig to vote MakerDAO’s veNFT on Velodrome Finance. SFCU believe DAI pairs and in particular DAI/stablecoin pairs will be most beneficial for DAI’s utility, but would encourage signers to coordinate with the Velodrome Finance team to maximize DAI liquidity and trading fees.    Create a MIP47 Compliant Multi-sig to manage the $VELO veNFT?  Yes, create a 3/4 MIP47 Multi-sig No, do nothing and receive no revenue from trading fees/bribes Abstain     0 voters
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to create a 3/4 multi-sig to manage the airdrop MakerDAO received from Velodrome Finance. The proposal aims to manage the veNFT in a maximally decentralized way, and the author is seeking four trusted community members to volunteer to be signers for a MIP47 compliant multi-sig to vote MakerDAO’s veNFT on Velodrome Finance. The post also includes information on the motivation behind the proposal and the potential benefits for DAI's utility. A 3rd party could provide constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: ACREinvest volunteers! We voted yes because Kianga is passionate about metaGovernance as a powerful lever for driving several key advantages for the community. ACREinvest is scaling capacity to provide such services via our collaboration with ACRE DAOs, a tokenized community we co-founded to drive innovation and adoption of DeFi, ReFi and crypto primitives for impact investing. Our enthusiasm for the $VELO project and support for MakerDAO’s active engagement was expressed at the time of the initial airdrop [Signal Request] Incoming Velodrome Airdrop on Optimism - $VELO veNFT - #6 by ACREinvest    [Signal Request] Incoming Velodrome Airdrop on Optimism - $VELO veNFT   This is sooooo exciting! I am very interested in assisting with the active governance of this on behalf of MakerDAO so we do not have to rely on the Velodrome team. Would the community support a metaGovernance proposal from ACREinvest and anyone in particular have capacity to help me with a proposal?   Collaboration with Velodrome Finance was envisioned among the responsibilities we later proposed for @DaveringtonPLLC in our Chief Legal Officer SPF proposal (withdrawn during RFC) MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer    MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer   Establish and lead a MetaGovernance Oversight Committee (MGOC) via MIP46 – Parameter Proposal Groups submission. Similar in structure and operation to the MakerDAO Open Market Committee (MOMC), the MGOC would monitor and manage any governance obligations and opportunities associated with the DAO’s ownership of governance tokens in the MakerDAO treasury.   Happy to proceed with supporting this initiative in cooperation with what’s envisioned here.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: This is a summary of the governance impacts of this Signal Request from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid Signal Request. This SR gauges community sentiment towards creating a 3/4 Multisig (MIP47) to manage the airdrop received for the newly launched Velodrome protocol on Optimism.  The DAO’s veNFT are currently being handled by the Velodrome team. Multisig was chosen as best option, due to a lack of practical ways for PE to work with veNFT on L2.   This Signal Request will run until Friday, September 21, as stated above. If the outcome is in favour of proceeding, and an appropriate multi-sig on Optimism with named signers is created, an on-chain poll will follow. This SR has been assigned Low-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-10-03
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I already Vote with my VELO NFT on Velodrome and pay attention to rewards, so happy to help with multisig and NFT management as well. I would suggest something like a well trusted/known 3 of 5 or 3 of 6 just to make it easier to get 3 signers reasonably quickly but that is up to MakerDAO to do that. FYI to people who are unfamiliar there will also be the following weekly claimable income from the $VELO NFT:  VELO from the locked $veVELO in the NFT Share of the Bribes from the pools voted. Share of the Rewards from the pools voted.  I would suggest basically converting some of the Bribe/rewards into ETH for gas or for MakerDAO and basically re-invest the VELO into the NFT vs. selling it to retain voting weight as VELO rebases.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Thank you for volunteering ACREinvest, much appreciated!     ultraschuppi:  I assume SFCU is doing the hard work and just like our for signers? In that case: happy to help. Probably better to have more people on the multisig to avoid partial offline problems?   Thanks for volunteering Schuppi! We would recommend (and are happy to help with) leveraging the Velodrome team’s expertise regarding how emissions should be directed. They’ve spent a tremendous amount of time building models to understand what is optimal for each token. Today, IMO, we should support only DAI pairs, but there’s no reason why we couldn’t support future ecosystem tokens like ETHD, Elixir, and Meta Elixir if the End Game is approved. To be MIP47 compliant, we need 2/3 voters minimum - we could increase the amount of signers to 4/6 but trying to be conscious of the coordination efforts from the signers. Definitely open to changing if that’s what the community desires.     MakerMan:  I already Vote with my VELO NFT on Velodrome and pay attention to rewards, so happy to help with multisig and NFT management as well. I would suggest something like a well trusted/known 3 of 5 or 3 of 6 just to make it easier to get 3 signers reasonably quickly but that is up to MakerDAO to do that. FYI to people who are unfamiliar there will also be the following weekly claimable income from the $VELO NFT:  VELO from the locked $veVELO in the NFT Share of the Bribes from the pools voted. Share of the Rewards from the pools voted.  I would suggest basically converting some of the Bribe/rewards into ETH for gas or for MakerDAO and basically re-invest the VELO into the NFT vs. selling it to retain voting weight as VELO rebases.   Thanks for volunteering MakerMan - excellent to have someone onboard already familiar with voting and bribing within Velodrome. I’m open to changing the signers, but in order for this multi-sig to be Governance-owned and compliant with MIP47, a 2/3 voter quorum is needed.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: This SR has ended with a majority of non-abstain voters voting in favour. We will put a weekly poll on the voting portal on 2022-09-26.

Hey @Aes , Chatting this over internally with facilitators and MIP authors, this seems like a situation where we would want to get the multisig set up and confirmed before putting this up for vote. Generally, we have avoided doing this before an item is polled on in an attempt to prevent unnecessary spending/labor. However, in this case, we will essentially be instructing Velo to send the NFT to a multisig run by a group of people (that still need to be identified). In order to prevent the NFT being sent to an address that has not been approved by MKR  holders, we should be explicit and provide the address the NFT should be sent to, if this poll passes. We’re 5 days out from when this can be polled, so hoping this is enough time to set up before then. We can delay the poll if need be, but for security reasons we need the following defined before the poll is created:  A multisig address with 3/4 signature requirements (presumably, on Optimism). Confirmations in this thread with addresses from all signers.  Please let me know if you have any questions!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Drafting now, speak now or forever hold your peace!

I’m not entirely familiar with how VELO works. How much money/value will the multisig signers have access to? What kind of oversight will be in place to ensure that all funds remain safe and are returned to the DAO?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Chris.   I can’t answer the how much value the gnosis safe multisig will hold but I can give some general information about VELO on optimism. https://optimistic.etherscan.io/token/0x3c8b650257cfb5f272f799f5e2b4e65093a11a05#balances I have total outstanding VELO at 567M which at ~$.02 is ~11.34M give or take depending on actual market prices (I have seen VELO as high as .10 and as low as .016ish but this is from memory over past couple months. I would be surprised if Maker ends up with 10% VELO which would be 56.7M (and would be like 15% of the locked voting veVELO if locked in the voting NFT for 4 years).   Will have to wait to hear on specific details. Second point is that to vote on VELO rewards one has to LOCK the VELO into a NFT for some period.   Example is you get one veVELO vote for 1 VELO locked for 4 years.   This ofc changes to something more like 1/208 veVELO for 1 VELO locked for 1 week.    Total voting power is (on last calculation based on voting %'s) about 340-350M veVELO. Point here is that typically people are locking for long periods to get the greatest voting power, and hence the maximum voting rewards (via LP fees, bribes, etc.), once the VELo is locked into the NFT it can’t be removed from the NFT until locking expiration, but one could send the NFT to another wallet. I already started some research on which LPs Maker might want to support and returns on these vary but run from 0% up to something like 200-300% (4-6%/week return) in $$ value.   Depends on how much VELO Maker has, and how long to lock which will determine the veVELO voting power but to put this into some perspective. Every 100K worth of veVELO (assume 1:1 ratio to VELO value for a 4yr lock) worth currently $2K US one can earn up to 4-6%/week (or 80-120 $$ US.weej) in bribes and fees. Since the goal of locking and voting this VELO will probably be to encourage DAI liquidity on Velodrome I don’t expect returns to be as high as above and given the constant VELO rebases for the VELO price to continue to drop over time.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

An interesting topic came up when discussing signing addresses: How can we change the address of one of the signees in case of loss of access, in case a signer’s wallet has been compromised, or in the case of a signer wanting to use another wallet as initially specified? Of course, this is a very small issue, but it highlights the need for an unbureaucratic way to change parameters and affect small-scale changes publicly and transparently. Currently, a signer’s address change on the veNFT wallet would need to go through a MIP, according to @prose11, since the original multi-sig resulted from an ad-hoc signal. A MIP is overblown for a humdrum change like that. We need a low-intensity method to maintain the system’s already approved and working parts. Tagging @rune and @prose11 here for guidance on the ideal process. My proposal: Change request forum polls that cannot propose new items but only change already existing parameters. These change request polls could be delineated so they cannot change or influence any meaningful parameter. In the example above: A multi-sig signer could not be swapped out for a different signer. Just a different address by the same signer or signing organization. Examples: Change multi-sig signer address Change an off-chain parameter
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Suggest using MIP46 Parameter Proposal Groups here. Thanks to @PaperImperium for digging that up. Advantages: Established process Can be well scoped No lone actors (have to be two members agreeing at least) Feedback welcome. (@rune and @prose11)
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Isn’t mip46 about parameters of the protocol? What are the parameters here? Maybe I am not creative enough, but I wouldn’t consider veNFT-management part of the protocol Part of the PPG framework is also the idea of multiple groups with overlapping parameters. This is clearly not the case here. There is just one multisig “owning” the maker-veNFT and performing the management. I actually don’t get why we make such a fuzz about this. @rspa has been approved as part of the multisig and he wishes to change his EOA on it. I fail to see the need for a signal, onchain poll, mip and what not…
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Hi, we’ve now had a chance to discuss this internally. Ultimately, it is our opinion that voters decided to authorise @rspa as a signer on the multisig, rather than a specific address. In the interests of reducing on-chain governance overhead, GovAlpha proposes the following solution.   @rspa posts signed verification that he is the owner of the new address he wishes to replace his old address on this multisig. GovAlpha will verify the signature and confirm we are happy for a change to be made. We pause until Monday. If there is no significant objection from the community, we can switch addresses for Raphael. If there are significant objections, GovAlpha will propose an on-chain poll for MKR voters to settle the matter. The transaction updating the signing wallet for Raphael on the multisig is posted in this thread for transparency.  Let me or @prose11 know if you have issues with this. Or feel free to post in the thread.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
